refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The image file may contain an animation, if so the GtkImage will display an animation (GdkPixbufAnimation) instead of a static image.
GtkImage is a subclass of GtkMisc, which implies that you can align it (center, left, right) and add padding to it, using GtkMisc methods.

When handling events on the event box, keep in mind that coordinates in the image may be different from event box coordinates due to the alignment and padding settings on the image (see GtkMisc). The simplest way to solve this is to set the alignment to 0.0 (left/top), and set the padding to zero. Then the origin of the image will be the same as the origin of the event box.

Sometimes an application will want to avoid depending on external data files, such as image files. GTK+ comes with a program to avoid this, called gdk-pixbuf-csource. This program allows you to convert an image into a C variable declaration, which can then be loaded into a GdkPixbuf using gdk_pixbuf_new_from_inline().

refsect2.title: GtkImage
refsect2.para: This struct contain private data only and should be accessed by the functions below.

refsect2.title: enum GtkImageType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY, GTK_IMAGE_PIXMAP, GTK_IMAGE_IMAGE, GTK_IMAGE_PIXBUF, GTK_IMAGE_STOCK, GTK_IMAGE_ICON_SET, GTK_IMAGE_ANIMATION, GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME, GTK_IMAGE_GICON } GtkImageType;
refsect2.para: Describes the image data representation used by a GtkImage. If you want to get the image from the widget, you can only get the currently-stored representation. e.g. if the gtk_image_get_storage_type() returns GTK_IMAGE_PIXBUF, then you can call gtk_image_get_pixbuf() but not gtk_image_get_stock(). For empty images, you can request any storage type (call any of the "get" functions), but they will all return NULL values.

listitem.simpara: there is no image displayed by the widget
the widget contains a stock icon name (see )
the widget contains a named icon. This image type was added in GTK+ 2.6
the widgte contains a GIcon. This image type was added in GTK+ 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_icon_set ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon set and size being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_ICON_SET (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()).

listitem.simpara: location to store a GtkIconSet, or NULL
location to store a stock icon size, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_image ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GdkImage and mask being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_IMAGE (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned image and mask.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GtkImage, or NULL
return location for a GdkBitmap, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_pixbuf ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GdkPixbuf being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_PIXBUF (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned pixbuf.

listitem.simpara: the displayed pixbuf, or NULL if the image is empty

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_pixmap ()
refsect2.para: Gets the pixmap and mask being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_PIXMAP (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned pixmap and mask.

listitem.simpara: location to store the pixmap, or NULL
location to store the mask, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_stock ()
refsect2.para: Gets the stock icon name and size being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_STOCK (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The returned string is owned by the GtkImage and should not be freed.

listitem.simpara: place to store a stock icon name, or NULL
place to store a stock icon size, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_animation ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GdkPixbufAnimation being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_ANIMATION (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned animation.

listitem.simpara: the displayed animation, or NULL if the image is empty

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_icon_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon name and size being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The returned string is owned by the GtkImage and should not be freed.

listitem.simpara: place to store an icon name, or NULL
place to store an icon size, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_gicon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GIcon and size being displayed by the GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or GTK_IMAGE_GICON (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned GIcon.

listitem.simpara: place to store a GIcon, or NULL
place to store an icon size, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_image_get_storage_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the type of representation being used by the GtkImage to store image data. If the GtkImage has no image data, the return value will be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_file ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkImage displaying the file filename. If the file isn't found or can't be loaded, the resulting GtkImage will display a "broken image" icon. This function never returns NULL, it always returns a valid GtkImage widget.
If the file contains an animation, the image will contain an animation.

If you need to detect failures to load the file, use gdk_pixbuf_new_from_file() to load the file yourself, then create the GtkImage from the pixbuf. (Or for animations, use gdk_pixbuf_animation_new_from_file()).
The storage type (gtk_image_get_storage_type()) of the returned image is not defined, it will be whatever is appropriate for displaying the file.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_icon_set ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage displaying an icon set. Sample stock sizes are GTK_ICON_SIZE_MENU, GTK_ICON_SIZE_SMALL_TOOLBAR. Instead of using this function, usually it's better to create a GtkIconFactory, put your icon sets in the icon factory, add the icon factory to the list of default factories with gtk_icon_factory_add_default(), and then use gtk_image_new_from_stock(). This will allow themes to override the icon you ship with your application.
The GtkImage does not assume a reference to the icon set; you still need to unref it if you own references. GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_image ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage widget displaying a image with a mask. A GdkImage is a client-side image buffer in the pixel format of the current display. The GtkImage does not assume a reference to the image or mask; you still need to unref them if you own references. GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_pixbuf ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkImage displaying pixbuf. The GtkImage does not assume a reference to the pixbuf; you still need to unref it if you own references. GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.
Note that this function just creates an GtkImage from the pixbuf. The GtkImage created will not react to state changes. Should you want that, you should use gtk_image_new_from_icon_set().

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_pixmap ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage widget displaying pixmap with a mask. A GdkPixmap is a server-side image buffer in the pixel format of the current display. The GtkImage does not assume a reference to the pixmap or mask; you still need to unref them if you own references. GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_stock ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage displaying a stock icon. Sample stock icon names are GTK_STOCK_OPEN, GTK_STOCK_QUIT. Sample stock sizes are GTK_ICON_SIZE_MENU, GTK_ICON_SIZE_SMALL_TOOLBAR. If the stock icon name isn't known, the image will be empty. You can register your own stock icon names, see gtk_icon_factory_add_default() and gtk_icon_factory_add().

listitem.simpara: a new GtkImage displaying the stock icon

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_animation ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage displaying the given animation. The GtkImage does not assume a reference to the animation; you still need to unref it if you own references. GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.

Note that the animation frames are shown using a timeout with G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT. When using animations to indicate busyness, keep in mind that the animation will only be shown if the main loop is not busy with something that has a higher priority.

refsect2.title: gtk_image_new_from_icon_name ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the icon name isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.

listitem.simpara: a new GtkImage displaying the themed icon

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.para: Creates a GtkImage displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the icon name isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_image_set_pixel_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the pixel size to use for named icons. If the pixel size is set to a value != -1, it is used instead of the icon size set by gtk_image_set_from_icon_name().
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "file" property
refsect2.para: Filename to load and display.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "gicon" property
refsect2.para: The GIcon displayed in the GtkImage. For themed icons, If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: The "icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The name of the icon in the icon theme. If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "icon-set" property
refsect2.para: Icon set to display.

refsect2.title: The "icon-size" property
refsect2.para: Symbolic size to use for stock icon, icon set or named icon.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 4

refsect2.title: The "image" property
refsect2.para: A GdkImage to display.

refsect2.title: The "mask" property
refsect2.para: Mask bitmap to use with GdkImage or GdkPixmap.

refsect2.title: The "pixbuf" property
refsect2.para: A GdkPixbuf to display.

refsect2.title: The "pixbuf-animation" property
refsect2.para: GdkPixbufAnimation to display.

refsect2.title: The "pixel-size" property
refsect2.para: The "pixel-size" property can be used to specify a fixed size overriding the "icon-size" property for images of type GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME.
Allowed values: >= G_MAXULONG
Default value: -1
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "pixmap" property
refsect2.para: A GdkPixmap to display.

refsect2.title: The "stock" property
refsect2.para: Stock ID for a stock image to display.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "storage-type" property
refsect2.para: The representation being used for image data.
Default value: GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY
